des: "Use the drippings from pan-broiled steaks to make a simple and flavorful sauce. It can be made with either red or white wine, preferably a little of the wine that you plan to serve with the meat."
ins: Add garlic to drippings in pan; cook and stir for 2 minutes. Add wine; stir, scraping the bottom of the pan to deglaze.  Boil, stirring constantly, until syrupy.  Remove from heat.  Add 1 tablespoon butter, and stir until the it melts.  Repeat with remaining butter.  Stir in parsley, and serve.
